item.title: US agricultural machinery maker AGCO hit by ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: AGCO, a leading US-based agricultural machinery producer, has announced it was hit by a ransomware attack impacting some of its production facilities. [...]

item.title: QNAP fixes critical QVR remote command execution vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: QNAP has released several security advisories today to alert its customers about various fixes for flaws affecting its products. The one that stands out is a critical RCE (remote code execution) in QVR. [...]

item.title: US sanctions Bitcoin laundering service used by North Korean hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The US Department of Treasury today sanctioned cryptocurrency mixer Blender.io used last month by the North Korean-backed Lazarus hacking group to launder funds stolen from Axie Infinity's Ronin bridge. [...]

item.title: NVIDIA fined for failure to disclose cryptomining sales boost
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) announced Friday that it settled charges against multinational tech firm NVIDIA for "inadequate disclosures" of cryptomining's impact on its gaming business. [...]

item.title: SheetJS ditches npm registry over 2FA requirement and 'legal matters'
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: In a surprising move, the popular open source project, SheetJS aka "xlsx," has dropped support for the npm registry. Downloaded about 1.4 million times every week on npm, SheetJS is relied upon by NodeJS developers looking to craft and parse Excel spreadsheets using nothing but JavaScript. [...]

item.title: Google Docs crashes on seeing "And. And. And. And. And."
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: A bug in Google Docs is causing it to crash when a series of words are typed into a document opened with the online word processor. BleepingComputer was able to reproduce the issue last night and reached out to Google. [...]

item.title: New Raspberry Robin worm uses Windows Installer to drop malware
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Red Canary intelligence analysts have discovered a new Windows malware with worm capabilities that spreads using external USB drives. [...]

item.title: White House: Prepare for cryptography-cracking quantum computers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: President Joe Biden signed a national security memorandum (NSM) on Thursday asking government agencies to implement a set of measures that would mitigate risks posed by quantum computers to US national cyber security. [...]

item.title: Ukraine’s IT Army is disrupting Russia's alcohol distribution
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hacktivists operating on the side of Ukraine have focused their DDoS attacks on a portal that is considered crucial for the distribution of alcoholic beverages in Russia. [...]

item.title: NIST updates guidance for defending against supply-chain attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) has released updated guidance on securing the supply chain against cyberattacks. [...]

item.title: FTC to force ISP to deploy fiber for 60K users to match speed claims
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) today proposed an order requiring Connecticut-based internet service provider Frontier Communications to stop "lying" to its customers and support its high-speed internet claims. [...]

item.title: Microsoft, Apple, and Google to support FIDO passwordless logins
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft, Apple, and Google announced today plans to support a common passwordless sign-in standard (known as passkeys) developed by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) and the FIDO Alliance. [...]

item.title: Google fixes actively exploited Android kernel vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google has released the second part of the May security patch for Android, including a fix for an actively exploited Linux kernel vulnerability. [...]
